intro: Cuprella homalocarpa, commonly known as the broad-leaf cuprella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with a broad, flat structure and small, white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and streambanks. Its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. The botanical features of Cuprella homalocarpa make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
